H0.text: Decibel levels are the levels that, when increased, result in sound waves that are louder and of greater intensity.

H1.text: Radiation levels, when increased, result in sound waves that are louder and of greater intensity.

H2.text: Height levels increase to produce sound waves that are louder and of greater intensity.

H3.text: Heat levels are the ones whose increase results in sound waves that are louder and of greater intensity.

A4.text: The human perception of the intensity of sound and light more nearly approximates the logarithm of intensity rather than a linear relationship (see Weberâ€“Fechner law), making the dB scale a useful measure.
